theorem.caption: Scalar product of a linear map is linear

info.caption: Comment: What does this proposition tell us?
info.para: This proposition gives us two strong pieces of information:

li.para: The scalar product of a linear transformation by a number is again linear
If the linear map L is represented by \Mtrx{A}, then the linear map (tL) is represented by the scalar product (t\cdot \Mtrx{A}).

info.para: In short: the scalar product of a linear map corresponds to the scalar product of the representing matrix.

statement.para:
